structured.description:
a simple camera module for Robocomp, which is a software framework for robotics and computer vision tasks. The module provides two queues: color_queue and depth_queue, where images and depth maps are stored respectively. The code also defines three methods: startup_check, video_color_thread, and video_depth_thread, which handle the startup of the camera, color image processing, and depth image processing threads.
The code also implements the getAll, getDepth, and getImage methods from the CameraRGBDSimple interface, which allow accessing the images and depth maps stored in the queues. The implementation uses Python's threading module to create separate threads for the color and depth image processing, and the QThreadPool class to manage the execution of these threads.

items.description: Manages two video streams (color and depth) from a robotic camera, queues the frames for processing, and provides methods to retrieve the frames as `TImage` or `TDepth` objects.

attributes.name: Period
attributes.description: 100, which represents the interval between consecutive updates of the worker's internal state.

attributes.name: hide
attributes.description: Used to hide or show the worker's GUI element when it is not needed, which helps improve performance by reducing flickering and minimizing CPU usage.

attributes.name: depth_queue
attributes.description: Used to store depth images read from a video capture device.

attributes.name: color_queue
attributes.description: Used to store the color frames read from the video capture devices.

attributes.name: color_stream
attributes.description: Used to capture color video streams.

attributes.name: depth_stream
attributes.description: Used to capture depth stream from a RTSP source.

attributes.name: color_thread
attributes.description: Used to represent a thread that runs in parallel with the main thread of the program, handling the color stream of the camera.

attributes.name: video_color_thread
attributes.description: Responsible for processing the color stream of the camera in a separate thread.

attributes.name: depth_thread
attributes.description: Used to start a separate thread for processing depth images.

attributes.name: video_depth_thread
attributes.description: Used to run a separate thread for reading depth frames from the camera.

attributes.name: startup_check
attributes.description: Called when the object is initialized. It tests if the RoboCompCameraRGBDSimple interfaces are available.

attributes.name: timer
attributes.description: Used to schedule a function call every `Period` milliseconds to update the worker's state.

attributes.name: compute
attributes.description: Defined as a slot function that is called by the timer. It performs no operation for now.

items.name: SpecificWorker

items.description: Initializes member variables and starts two threads to handle video streams for color and depth sensors, respectively.

params.name: proxy_map
params.description: Used to store a mapping of proxy servers for each worker instance, allowing for flexible configuration of proxy servers for different workers.

params.name: startup_check
params.description: Used to check if the worker has started correctly or not.

items.name: __init__

items.description: Processes two image-like objects, `pix_color` and `pix_depth`, scaling them to the size of the widgets `ui.color` and `ui.depth`. If the object is hidden, it returns `True`.
items.name: compute

items.description: Reads frames from an opened camera and adds them to a queue for processing, while handling exceptions and keyboard interrupts.

params.name: inqueue
params.description: Used to store the frames read from the video capture device during the video processing thread execution.

items.name: video_color_thread

items.description: Reads frames from a given video capture object `cap` and enqueues them in a queue `inqueue`. It repeatedly reads frames until the `cap` is closed, then releases the resource.

params.name: cap
params.description: Used to capture video frames from a video file or device.

params.name: inqueue
params.description: Used to store frames read from the video capture device.

items.name: video_depth_thread

items.description: Tests various components of a class called `ifaces.RoboCompCameraRGBDSimple`. These include the `TImage`, `TDepth`, and `TRGBD` classes, as well as the `QApplication.instance().quit()` method.
items.name: startup_check

items.description: Retrieves RGB-D data from a camera and stores it in a queue for processing. It returns the entire RGB-D data or `None` if the queue is empty.

params.name: camera
params.description: Used to retrieve RGB-D data from a RoboComp camera.

returns.description: A RGB-D image representing the depth and color information of a camera.

items.name: CameraRGBDSimple_getAll

items.description: Retrieves depth data from a queue and returns it in the form of a `TDepth` object with dimensions and depth value.

params.name: camera
params.description: An instance of the RoboCompCameraRGBDSimple class, which represents a camera for depth sensing.

returns.description: A struct containing height, width and depth information of a image.

items.name: CameraRGBDSimple_getDepth

items.description: Retrieves an image from a color queue and returns a `TImage` object with the appropriate dimensions and contents.

params.name: camera
params.description: An instance of a class representing a camera device.

returns.description: A struct containing height, width, depth and image values of a RGB-D camera frame.

items.name: CameraRGBDSimple_getImage

structured.description: A JoystickAdapter class that acts as an intermediary between a joystick and a robot's control system. It provides several methods for subscribing to updates from the joystick, including one for each of the four possible move modes (0, 1, 2, and 3), as well as one for home mode. Within each move mode method, the code updates the robot's position or orientation based on the inputs from the joystick axes and buttons. The code also defines a `robot2_target_pos` list to store the target positions of a second robot, which is not shown in the code snippet provided.

items.description: Manages communication between a robot's kinematic structure and a joystick adapter, interpreting user inputs and generating corresponding robot movements. It implements four different move modes (home, rotate, move, and gripper) based on the joystick's input values.

attributes.name: Period
attributes.description: 1 second by default, indicating how often the worker will execute the `sendData` method.

attributes.name: rgb
attributes.description: Used to store the color of the robot's body, in RGB format.

attributes.name: startup_check
attributes.description: 0 by default, indicating that the worker has not been initialized or started yet. It is used to track the worker's startup state during initialization and startup processes.

attributes.name: physicsClient
attributes.description: Used to interact with the PyBullet physics engine. It provides methods for sending data to the robot and receiving data from the robot.

attributes.name: plane
attributes.description: Used to store the target position of the robot's end effector in a specific plane.

attributes.name: table_id
attributes.description: 0 by default, indicating that the worker is not associated with any specific table.

attributes.name: robot_urdf
attributes.description: Used to store the robot's URDF (Uniform Resource Locator Definition Framework) file, which defines the robot's geometry and joint movement.

attributes.name: robot_launch_pos
attributes.description: 4-dimensional, representing the initial position of the robot's end effector when it starts moving to a specific pose.

attributes.name: robot_launch_orien
attributes.description: 3x3 quaternion representing the orientation of the robot's end effector relative to its base link.

attributes.name: end_effector_link_index
attributes.description: 0-based index of the end effector link in the robot's arm, indicating which joint of the end effector to control.

attributes.name: home_angles
attributes.description: 1x7 matrix representing the angles for each joint of the robot to move it to its home position.

attributes.name: observation_angles
attributes.description: 2D, representing the angles of the end effector of the robot in radians for each joint.

attributes.name: observation_angles_2
attributes.description: 2D, representing the joint angles observed by the worker's end effector in PyBullet space. It contains the angles of the worker's end effector with respect to its base joints.

attributes.name: observation_angles_3
attributes.description: 3-dimensional, representing the angles observed by the worker's end effector in joint space. Each dimension corresponds to a different joint in the robot's arm.

attributes.name: observation_angles_cube
attributes.description: 4-dimensional, representing the angles of the robot's end effector (gripper) with respect to a fixed reference frame. It is used for computing the end effector's position in the world.

attributes.name: robot_id
attributes.description: 4 by default, indicating that this worker is a specific worker for a particular robot with ID 4.

attributes.name: pybullet_cup
attributes.description: A Pythonic way to access the cup object from within the class methods, allowing for more convenient use of the cup objects in the class.

attributes.name: square
attributes.description: 4 by default, which means that the worker will perform a square movement with a maximum angle of 360 degrees.

attributes.name: hilo_lectura
attributes.description: Used to read data from a hilo sensor. It handles the communication with the hilo sensor and reads the data in a specific format.

attributes.name: readDataFromProxy
attributes.description:
Defined as:
```python
async def readDataFromProxy(self, data):
    ```
This attribute allows the worker to receive data from a PyBullet proxy server. The data is processed according to the move mode (0, 1, 2, or 3) and the buttons (home or move mode). The data is then used to update the joint angles and/or robot position.

attributes.name: target_angles
attributes.description: 7-element list representing the target angles for each joint of a robot (in radians) for the specific worker.

attributes.name: target_position
attributes.description: Used to store the target position of the robot's end effector in a specific task. It is used as input for the forward kinematics calculation to get the joint angles required to reach the desired position.

attributes.name: target_orientation
attributes.description: Used to store the target orientation of the robot after taking into account the joint angles, gripper position, and the current time step.

attributes.name: target_velocities
attributes.description: 1x3, containing the target velocities for each joint of the robot in radians per second.

attributes.name: joy_selected_joint
attributes.description: Used to keep track of the joint selected by the user through the joystick. It starts at 0 and goes through 6, where each number corresponds to a different joint in the robot's arm.

attributes.name: move_mode
attributes.description: 0, 1, or 2, indicating which control mode the worker should be in: (0) joystick, (1) teleoperation, or (2) simulation.

attributes.name: n_rotations
attributes.description: Used to store the total number of rotations that the robot has performed since its last reset. It helps track the robot's movement and control its actions accordingly.

attributes.name: ext_joints
attributes.description: A list of joints that are external to the robot, such as a gripper or a wrist.

attributes.name: kinovaarm_proxy
attributes.description:
Used to store the connection between the PyRobot and Kinova arm, allowing the worker to send 
command to the robot.

attributes.name: ext_gripper
attributes.description: A list of gripper angles for each joint in the robot. It is used to control the movement of the gripper in conjunction with the joystick movements.

attributes.name: posesTimes
attributes.description:
Initialized to a single element representing the current time in milliseconds since the 
start of the simulation. It can be used to store the current state of the robot at a given time.

attributes.name: poses
attributes.description:
Filled with joint angles in radians for each time step, representing the worker's pose in a 
specific task. The values range from 0 to 2Ï€.

attributes.name: timestamp
attributes.description: Used to store the current time in milliseconds since the epoch (1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC) for each worker.

attributes.name: timer
attributes.description: 0 by default, it counts the time spent in the `def __init__` method of the worker, to manage the workers' lifetime.

attributes.name: compute
attributes.description: Computed based on the joint values. It is used to update the gains for each joint.

attributes.name: timer2
attributes.description: Used to store the time taken by the worker to complete its task.

attributes.name: movePybulletWithExternalVel
attributes.description: Defined as a method that takes in the desired joint angles and external velocity as inputs and uses PyBullet to move the robot to the specified position and velocity.

attributes.name: joint_speeds
attributes.description: 7-dimensional, representing the joint speeds for each joint of a robot in a specific work mode.

attributes.name: gains
attributes.description: Used to store the joint angles error values for each joint, used in the control algorithm to adjust the desired positions of the end effector.

attributes.name: speeds
attributes.description: 1x3 with values representing the desired joint angles for each joint in radians per second, indicating the movement speed of the robot.

attributes.name: angles
attributes.description: 1x7, representing the joint angles of a kinematic robot arm in radians.

attributes.name: timer3
attributes.description: 3, indicating that the worker's move mode is set to 3, which corresponds to the "home" mode.

attributes.name: moveKinovaWithSpeeds
attributes.description: 1-based indexing of a list containing speeds for each joint in the robot, which are used to move the robot's end effector to a specific position with desired speed.

attributes.name: timer4
attributes.description: 4, indicating that the worker is a specific one with 4 modes for the joystick.

attributes.name: movePybulletWithToolbox
attributes.description: Used to move the robot using PyBullet, sending joystick data to it.

attributes.name: colorKinova
attributes.description: Used to store the color of the Kinova gripper, which can be any valid color string recognized by PyBullet.

attributes.name: depthKinova
attributes.description: 3D, representing the robot's depth sensor readings as a 3D array.

attributes.name: calibrator
attributes.description: Used to store calibration data for a specific robot model.

attributes.name: timer5
attributes.description: 5 by default, which represents the time (in milliseconds) it takes to execute the `JoystickAdapter_sendData()` method for the fifth move mode.

attributes.name: readKinovaCamera
attributes.description: Responsible for reading the camera data from the Kinova robot's camera sensor, which provides 2D images of the environment.

attributes.name: timer6
attributes.description: 6, which indicates that the worker has been running for 6 seconds.

attributes.name: correctCupPosition
attributes.description: 0 or 1, indicating whether the cup position is correct or not based on the target position received from the joystick adapter.

attributes.name: aamed
attributes.description: A list of tuples, where each tuple contains the name of an axis (either "X", "Y", or "Z") and the corresponding value for that axis. It is used to store the desired position and orientation of the end effector in the robot's coordinate system.

items.name: SpecificWorker

items.description: Of the SpecificWorker class sets up the kinova arm and cups, reads the camera feed, computes the joint angles, and starts timers for moving the kinova arm and reading the camera feed.

params.name: proxy_map
params.description: Used to map the PyBullet joint names to the Kinova arm joint names.

params.name: startup_check
params.description: 0 by default. It's used to check if the robot arm is connected and ready for use before initializing the Kinova arm object.

items.name: __init__

items.description: Sets parameters for an object of a subclass of `GenericWorker`. It returns `True` upon successful execution, without providing any additional information or context.

returns.description: 1 if successful or an error message if not.

items.name: setParams

items.description: Performs calibration and movement tasks for a robotic system, including reading camera images, tracking angles, and moving the robot's end effector to specific positions. It also handles different modes of operation based on the input from the user.
items.name: compute

items.description: Tests various components and interfaces of the RoboCompKinovaArm library, including TPose, TGripper, TJoint, TJoints, AxisParams, ButtonParams, and TData, before calling QApplication.instance().quit after a 200 millisecond delay.
items.name: startup_check

items.description: Compares the positions and orientations of two images captured by a camera and a Kinova robot, respectively, using PyBullet and OpenCV. It calculates the error between them and adjusts the position of the cup in PyBullet to minimize the error.

returns.description: The difference between the positions of two objects in a simulation, calculated using the PyBullet and Kinova libraries.

items.name: correctCupPosition

items.description: Initializes various components of the worker's environment, including grippers, end-effector, and cups. It also sets the desired end-effector pose and defines the time step for simulation.
items.name: initialize_toolbox

items.description: Performs various calculations related to the robot's position, velocity, and joint angles. It computes the robot's end effector position, updates the robot's position and orientation, and calculates the error between the robot's current state and its desired state. Additionally, it sets the target velocities for the robot's joints.
items.name: toolbox_compute

items.description: Computes and returns a camera image based on the intrinsic parameters and view matrix obtained from a robot's link state message.

returns.description: An image of size (width x height) in BGR color format, along with a timestamp in milliseconds since the start of the program.

items.name: read_camera_fixed

items.description: Retrieves RGB and depth images from a Kinova camera, normalizes the depth image, and appends both images to instance variables `depthKinova` and `colorKinova`. It also displays the first frame of the color image using `cv2.imshow()`.

returns.description: `True` if the operation was successful, otherwise it raises an exception.

items.name: readKinovaCamera

items.description: Calculates and prints the radians of the joint angles of a SpecificWorker, which inherits from GenericWorker.
items.name: showKinovaAngles

items.description: Updates the target velocities of a robot's joints based on external joint velocities, and then sets the motor control targets for the robot using PyBullet.
items.name: movePybulletWithExternalVel

items.description: Controls the velocity of a robot's joints using PyBullet's motor control feature, with inputs from a list of target velocities.
items.name: movePybulletWithToolbox

items.description: Reads data from a proxy server regarding joints and gripper state, applies a 0.8 multiplier to the gripper distance, and sleeps for 0.05 seconds before repeating the process.
items.name: readDataFromProxy

items.description: Converts angles into degrees and rounds them to the nearest degree, then passes the list of joint angles to the `moveJointsWithAngle` method of the `kinovaarm_proxy` object.

params.name: angles
params.description: 360-degree radian angles to move the kinova arm.

items.name: moveKinovaWithAngles

items.description: Sets joint speeds for a Kinova arm based on gains and joint states, and passes the speeds to the `moveJointsWithSpeed` method of the `kinovaarm_proxy` object.
items.name: moveKinovaWithSpeeds

items.description: Updates the joint angles and their gains based on the difference between the actual joint angle and the target angle, and also prints the current joint angles and gains to the console.
items.name: updateGains

items.description: Handles incoming data from a joystick and updates the position and orientation of a robot based on the input values. It also responds to button presses and moves the robot's gripper as needed.

params.name: data
params.description: Passed the data from an external joystick, containing information about axis values and button presses.

items.name: JoystickAdapter_sendData
